items.content: Major flaw in that argument. On planet Earth, gold and silver is finite, just like Bitcoin. We have good estimates of how much the planet contains. Price must rise to reflect a) inflation and b) the costs involved in getting at deeper deposits or space missions to mine asteroids.
items.content_text_vi: Major flaw in that argument. On planet Earth, gold and silver is finite, just like Bitcoin. We have good estimates of how much the planet contains. Price must rise to reflect a) inflation and b) the costs involved in getting at deeper deposits or space missions to mine asteroids.

items.content:
It's simple:

Too many paper claims.
Too little physical silver.

Continued rising physical delivery demand ->

-> Shorts have to cover
-> Short squeeze (price )
-> Massive bank losses
-> Contagion to the financial system
-> Bank runs & flight into safe havens gold & silver
